summary: Wales is a country located in the British Isles, sharing a border with England. With a population of 3.2 million, it boasts a diverse landscape of mountains, coastlines, and lush greenery. Cardiff, the capital, is the largest city. Historically, Wales developed its unique culture after the Romans left Britain. It experienced periods of unity and conflict, eventually becoming part of England in the 16th century. Today, Wales has its own parliament and enjoys a balanced economy through public services, tourism, and agriculture. Both Welsh and English are official languages, with Welsh primarily spoken in the north and west.
title: Wales
